channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WV

item.title: Report E-2024100668
item.description:
Report E-2024100668

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-29
  • City: HURRICANE
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver stopped at rest area for a load check and noticed liquid dripping from trailer. Driver called the emergency respace number and crews were dispatched to the scene for clean up. Driver was informed to call 911 due to not being able to contain the dripping from running off and there were rain showers present in the area. The fire department showed up on scene and were able to place absorbent down to prevent any runoff. The response crew showed up on scene at 2045et. The crew unloaded the drums to gain access to the leaking container. 2200 the container was accessed and was placed into the Salvage Drum and all absorbents were added to the drum that were used during the clean up. 2245et the trailer was reloaded and secured for transport and job was completed.
